required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Oxygenation of the Brain During Caesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: The Oxygenation of the Brain During Caesarean Section. A Comparison of Ephedrine Versus Phenylephrine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the impact of phenylephrine versus ephedrine on organ perfusion, in women undergoing caesarean section receiving spinal anaesthesia. The organ perfusion is estimated by measuring the maternal cerebral oxygenation by NIRS(Near-infrared spectroscopy)and the foetal heartrate.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the time in the operation theatre of the hospital stay, an expected average of 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: Determine the frontal lobe cerebral oxygantion by Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS),from before induction of spinal anaesthesia to end of surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the time in the operation theatre of the hospital stay, an expected average of 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: From before induction of spinal anaesthesia to 15 min after delivery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the time in the operation theatre of the hospital stay, an expected average of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: The mean arterial pressure is measures from before induction of spinal anaesthesia to end of surgery.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the time in the operation theatre of the hospital stay, an expected average of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: The cardiac output is measures from before induction of spinal anaesthesia to end of surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Umbilical cord pH and Base excess
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood analysis taken immediately after the the clamping of the umbilical cord, an average of 20 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: The umbilical cord blood analysis for evaluation of the newborn's acid-base status is taken immediately after delivery. It is the most objective way of assessing the fetal metabolic condition at birth.

intervention.description: An infusion with a maximum of 3 mg/minute for maximum 60 minutes or if sideeffects develope.
An infusion of maximum 4 mg/hour for maximum 60 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy pregnant women
- Over 18 years old
- ASA 1-2
- Undergoing elective caesarean section
- Height over 160 cm or under 180 cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergic reactions to ephedrine or phenylephrine
- High blood levels of bilirubin
- HELPP syndrome
- Preeclampsia (pregnancy-induced hypertension)
- Non singleton pregnancies
